questions.q: Is HTML considered a programming language?
questions.explanation: The sources explicitly state that HTML is not a programming language; it is a markup language used to describe the structure of web pages.
options: Yes, it is a standard programming language
No, it is a markup language

questions.q: In what year was the HTML5 version released?
questions.explanation: The HTML Versions table in the sources lists HTML5 as being released in 2014.

questions.q: Which simple text editor is recommended for the course examples on Windows?
questions.explanation: While Dreamweaver and CoffeeCup are professional editors, the sources state that for simple examples, only Notepad (Windows) is needed.

questions.q: What is the primary purpose of a web browser regarding HTML tags?
questions.explanation: The sources state that browsers do not display HTML tags but use them to determine how to display the document.
options: To display the HTML tags to the user
To edit the HTML tags within the browser
To read HTML documents and use tags to determine how to display content, without displaying the tags themselves
To compile HTML into machine code

questions.q: How is an HTML 'end tag' correctly written?
questions.explanation:
According to the sources, an end tag is written like a start tag but with a forward slash inserted before the tag name, such as

.
options: The same as the start tag
With a backslash (\) before the tag name
With a forward slash (/) before the tag name
With a dot (.) before the tag name

questions.q: Which tag represents the root element of an HTML page?
questions.explanation: The sources identify the <html> tag as the root element that encloses the complete HTML document.

questions.q: Which heading tag defines the least important heading?
questions.explanation: The sources state that <h1> defines the most important heading and <h6> defines the least important heading.

questions.q: Which of the following statements about HTML is TRUE?
questions.explanation: The sources mention that HTML is not case sensitive and does not get affected by spaces or line breaks.
options: HTML is affected by extra spaces and line breaks in the code
HTML language is not case sensitive and is not affected by spaces and line breaks
HTML only supports text and graphics, not sound or video

questions.q: Which tag is used to define 'subscripted' text?
questions.explanation: Based on the HTML Text Formatting Elements table, <sub> is used for subscripted text and <sup> is for superscripted text.

questions.q: Which tag contains meta information about the document and is not visible on the page itself?
questions.explanation: The sources state that the <head> tag contains meta information about the document, while the <body> contains the visible page content.
